vehicles.description: A red truck with a yellow cabin is driving on the wrong side of the road, moving in the opposite direction of my vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: This truck is a moving obstacle, and autonomous vehicles must maintain a safe following distance from it, always ready to adapt to potential changes in the truck's speed or lane position.

vehicles.description: A white van is in front of our vehicle, moving in the same direction along the same lane.
vehicles.explanation: This truck has determined the safe driving distance and speed it must maintain. Additionally, it is recommended to regularly check the rearview mirrors and blind spots to prevent accidents with other road users who might be invisible.

vehicles.description: A blue car is on the same lane ahead of my vehicle, also traveling in the same direction.
vehicles.explanation: The lead vehicle needs to monitor the speed and distance of the blue car to prevent rear-ending and be ready to adjust its speed according to the vehicle's dynamics.

vulnerable_road_users.description: On the right side of the road, there are workers in the area marked by caution tape, next to a pile of rubble.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Workers operating near the road may suddenly enter the roadway, so it is advised to proceed with caution.

barriers.description: Temporary fencing has been erected around the area where the workers are located, reinforcing the boundary between the construction site and the road.
barriers.explanation: These obstacles reinforce the need for autonomous vehicles to stay in the left lane, or if they are currently in the right lane, to merge left cautiously.

other objects.description: The construction site by the roadside or obstacles and debris on the right side reveal equipment and materials.
other objects.explanation: Paying attention to the fragments on the roadside is important, to prevent them from accidentally entering the roadway.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image captured, there are several notable elements that affect the navigation of autonomous vehicles. The vehicles identified include a red truck with a yellow cabin traveling on the wrong side of the road, heading towards the direction opposite to the autonomous vehicle's; this truck poses a risk as an oncoming obstacle, and thus a safe following distance must be ensured. There is also a white van directly ahead, traveling in the same lane and direction as the autonomous vehicle; maintaining a safe driving distance and regular monitoring for other road users through mirrors is essential to prevent accidents. Additionally, a blue car in the same lane ahead of my vehicle is moving in the same direction, and the autonomous vehicle must keep track of its speed and distance to prevent rear collisions.

A group of road workers is present on the right side, within an area demarcated by caution tape, adjacent to a rubble pile. Their proximity to the road warrants careful driving to anticipate a potential sudden entry of workers onto the roadway.

Barriers associated with the construction zone, specifically temporary fencing, have been set up around the workers to delineate the boundary between the construction site and the road. These barriers indicate the necessity for autonomous vehicles to either remain in the left lane or merge left with caution from the right lane.

Lastly, there are various other elements located by the roadside construction site or within the debris on the right, which display both equipment and materials. It is crucial to be vigilant regarding these roadside fragments to avoid any unintentional encroachment onto the road.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a safe distance from the vehicle in front, adjust the speed according to the dynamics of the truck, and be cautious in construction areas, driving in lanes away from temporary fences. Pay attention to the movements of workers and be ready to react to situations where they might enter the lane. Furthermore, frequently check the rearview mirror and blind spots to prevent potential unseen road users. If your vehicle is in the right lane, safely merge into the left lane before reaching an obstacle to avoid the narrowing right lane. When passing through construction areas or by debris on the roadside, slow down and be alert for any unexpected obstacles.

1.description and explanation: A small four-wheeled hand cart is positioned on the roadside. As an inanimate object, it is not a direct participant in traffic, but its presence is significant for driving behavior. The ego car should maintain a safe distance from the cart to avoid any potential obstructions in its path and to prepare for the possibility that it might unexpectedly enter the road if moved by an external force or by someone not visible in the image. Caution should be exercised, as the space it occupies reduces the usable width of the right-most lane and makes it less safe for vehicles to pass by without changing lanes.
